ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: I'll recommend this course to a fellow student, because it works like a guide into the field of Solid State Physics where a lot complex and intertwined concepts about solid are presented.
Fantastic introduction to solid state physics. Probably the most applicable physics class I have taken so far.
I would recommend it to other students to be introduced to solid state physics, and is very useful in many areas if research
I would definitely recommend this course
I would recommend this course if a student has never seen any solid state physics. Otherwise, skip.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: It gives me a background for doing materials research, especially about the phonons and semiconductors, which may be the most important parts for the materials. I may occasionally look back to all these knowlege since they are quite related to my research.
It helps me to set up an insight into materials which maybe I deal with.
It really gave me the background for the type of research that I do (phonons!). Homework questions were often applicable to research that I am currently doing and will do in the future.
The course was very helpful for research and I have already found many of the materials useful during my first semester.
This course did not deepen my knowledge.
